intro: Grastidium morotaiense, commonly known as the Morotai stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Morotai in Indonesia. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Grastidium morotaiense is considered a rare and endemic species.
